info.title: Tricia API
info.description: API for Tricia conversational AI platform (prod mode)

post.description:
Create a new user.

This endpoint creates a user with the provided information.
The user_id is specified in the request body.

Authentication:
- Authentication is required via bearer token

get.description:
List all users with pagination.

This endpoint returns a list of users.

Authentication:
- Authentication is required via bearer token
- Only superusers can access this endpoint

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of users to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of users to return

schema.title: Response List Users Api V1 Users Get

get.description:
Get user by ID.

This endpoint retrieves a specific user by their ID.
Returns the complete user profile including:
- Basic profile information
- IDs of owned agents (use /api/v1/agents/{id} to get full agent details)
- IDs of followed agents (use /api/v1/agents/{id} to get full agent details)
- IDs of owned journals (use /api/v1/journals/{id} to get full journal details)
- Memory data

Authentication:
- Requires valid authentication token
- User can only access their own user record
- Admin users can access any user record

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: The ID of the user to get
schema.title: User Id

parameters.description: The ID of the user to get

patch.description:
Update a user's profile or memory information.

This unified endpoint handles both profile updates and memory updates.
Provide either user_update or memory_update or both.

Authentication:
- Authentication is required via bearer token
- Only superusers can access this endpoint

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: The ID of the user to update
schema.title: User Id

parameters.description: The ID of the user to update

delete.description:
Delete a user without checking existence.

This endpoint attempts to delete a user account and all associated data.
Success is returned regardless of whether the user exists.

Authentication:
- Authentication is required via bearer token

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: The ID of the user to delete
schema.title: User Id

parameters.description: The ID of the user to delete

schema.title: Response Delete User Api V1 Users  User Id  Delete

get.description:
Get the current authenticated user.

Returns the user profile of the authenticated user.

Authentication:
- Authentication is required via bearer token
- Only superusers can access this endpoint

patch.description:
Update the current authenticated user's profile or memory.

This unified endpoint handles both profile updates and memory updates.
Provide either user_update or memory_update or both.

Authentication:
- Authentication is required via bearer token
- Only superusers can access this endpoint

post.description:
Manage relationship between a user and an agent.

Updates the relationship between the specified user and agent.

Query parameters:
- agent_id: ID of the agent to follow/unfollow
- action: 'follow' to follow the agent, 'unfollow' to unfollow

Authentication:
- Authentication is required via bearer token
- Users can only manage relationships for their own account
- Superusers can manage relationships for any user

get.description:
List all agents.

Returns a list of all agents in the system. This is an admin-only endpoint.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of agents to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of agents to return

schema.title: Response List All Agents Api V1 Agents Get

post.description:
Create a new agent (without trailing slash).

This is a duplicate of the create_agent endpoint for compatibility with clients
that don't include the trailing slash in the URL.

get.description:
Discover public agents.

Returns a list of publicly discoverable agents.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of agents to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of agents to return

schema.title: Response Discover Agents Api V1 Agents Discover Get

post.description:
Create a new agent.

Expects a request with the following required fields:
- name: Agent name
- owner_id: User ID of the owner

Optional fields:
- description: Agent description (defaults to empty string)
- is_public: Whether the agent is publicly discoverable (defaults to false)
- avatar_url: URL to agent avatar image (optional)

Configuration fields (all optional with domain model defaults):
- agent_type: Technology type used by the agent (defaults to "voicepipeline")
- llm_model: Language model used by the agent (defaults to "gpt-4o-mini")
- voice: TTS voice used by the agent (defaults to "alloy")

Returns the created agent.

get.description:
Get a specific agent by ID.

Returns the agent with the specified ID if it exists.

parameters.name: agent_id

schema.description: The ID of the agent to retrieve
schema.title: Agent Id

parameters.description: The ID of the agent to retrieve

patch.description:
Update an agent.

Updates the fields of an existing agent with the values provided in the request.
Only fields provided in the request will be updated.

Optional fields that can be updated:
- name: Agent name
- description: Agent description
- is_public: Whether the agent is publicly discoverable
- avatar_url: URL to agent avatar image
- agent_type: Technology type used by the agent
- llm_model: Language model used by the agent
- voice: TTS voice used by the agent

parameters.name: agent_id

schema.description: The ID of the agent to update
schema.title: Agent Id

parameters.description: The ID of the agent to update

delete.description:
Delete an agent.

Deletes the agent with the specified ID. Authorization is handled before this endpoint is reached.
Admin users can force deletion by setting force=true.

parameters.name: agent_id

schema.description: The ID of the agent to delete
schema.title: Agent Id

parameters.description: The ID of the agent to delete

parameters.name: force

schema.description: Force deletion by admin (bypasses owner validation)
schema.title: Force

parameters.description: Force deletion by admin (bypasses owner validation)

get.description: List all chats in the system.

schema.title: Response List Chats Api V1 Chats Get

post.description: Create a new chat with an agent and establish LiveKit room connection.
Update a chat with conversation data and usage metrics.

parameters.name: chat_id

schema.description: ID of the chat to update
schema.title: Chat Id

parameters.description: ID of the chat to update

get.description: Get a specific chat with all messages.

delete.description: Delete a chat and all its messages.

post.description:
Create a new journal.

The user_id in the request must match the authenticated user
or have appropriate permissions to create on behalf of the user.

The agent_id must be a valid agent ID.

schema.description: Journal data including user_id and agent_id

get.description:
List journals.

When user_id is provided, returns journals owned by that user.
When user_id is not provided, returns all journals (admin only).

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of journals to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of journals to return

schema.title: Response List Journals Api V1 Journals Get

get.description:
Get a journal by ID.

The user must be either the owner of the journal or have it shared with them.

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: User ID requesting access to the journal
schema.title: User Id

parameters.description: User ID requesting access to the journal

patch.description:
Update a journal.

Only the journal owner can update it.

delete.description:
Delete a journal.

When user_id is provided, verifies owner permission.
When user_id is not provided, deletes the journal directly (admin mode).

post.description:
Search journals using semantic search.

Uses Mem0's semantic search capabilities to find journals based on content,
with filtering options for tags, people, and permissions.

The user_id in the request must match the authenticated user.

schema.description: The content to add to mem0
schema.title: Content
Response Create Mem0 Api V1 Journals Create Mem0 Post

post.description:
Update a memory.

This endpoint allows users to update a memory by specifying a journal ID.
The journal must be associated with the user and must exist.

schema.description: The content to add to mem0
schema.title: Content
Response Update Mem0 Api V1 Journals Update Mem0 Post
Response Search Mem0 Api V1 Journals Search Mem0 Post

post.description:
Export a memory.

This endpoint exports a memory from mem0 and returns it in a structured format.
The response includes title, narrative, date, people, and emotional significance.

get.description:
Root endpoint showing API status and connected services.
Provides a health check and configuration overview.

ChatCreateRequest.title: ChatCreateRequest

Schema for creating a new chat with an agent.

Note: User memory is automatically fetched from the user repository
and passed to the agent - clients do not need to provide this in the request.

examples.narrative: We gathered at Grandma's farm for our annual summer picnic. The weather was perfect - warm sunshine with a gentle breeze rustling through the apple trees. I remember the checkered blanket spread out on the soft grass, loaded with homemade delicacies. The lemonade was so refreshing, made from lemons picked that morning.
examples.title: Summer Picnic at Grandma's Farm
